page.title: 04FACILITIES
page.content: {Shopping.} There is a Co-op,selling both food and hardware, two general stores, a post office and a newsagents. Vans delivering milk, selling fish, meat, coal,tea and a greengrocer come round the village. One shop has an arrangement with a Crook butcher to sell meat. Medicine is brought by bus from Stanhope to be collected at a shop. There are two hairdressers and one public house, which does not serve meals. A{craft shop}is held in the Parish Hall selling local crafts. The{County Mobile Library}visits every alternate Wednesday, stopping at either end of the village for a limited period. Another library van visits outlying farms. A newly built{telephone exchange serves Weardale.
